name: Aspen Institute Central Europe
goal:
The Aspen Institute Central Europe is a Central European non-ideological platform for policy innovation and inclusive dialogue. It is a member of a global network of Aspen Institutes.

The branch based in Prague operates for Central Europe and tackles current political and economic affairs in the region. Policy areas it covers include among others digital agenda, creative industries, creative placemaking, Visegrad cooperation and transatlantic relations. In doing so it promotes the interdisciplinary cooperation, connecting professionals active in various fields.

We tackle developments in these areas in closed-door policy sessions, policy meetings as well as in the quarterly journal Aspen Review Central Europe.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Communication, Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Enterprise, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trade
euInitiatives:
- Digital agenda, DSM
- TTIP
- creative placemaking
